docTitle.titlePart: Monte Carlo Calculations on Molten TlCl, TlBr and Til

titlePage.byline:
Centre» di Studio per la termodinamica ed elettrochlmica dei sistemi salini fusi e solidi del CNR
Istituto di Chimica Fisica ed Elettrochimica, Universita di Pavia, Italy

front.div:
Molten TIC1, TlBr and Til were computer simulated at two different temperatures using the
interionic pair potentials obtained by Mayer on the corresponding solids. The calculated molar
volumes in comparison with the experimental ones show that the simulated molten TlCl and
TlBr are only slightly relaxed ( 1—2, 2—3%, respectively ). On the contrary, molten Til is strongly
relaxed ( 23—27% ) and behaves as if an important cohesive force like the homopolar one would
be lacking.
